Message.Msg: Paul Wilkes, you are a nasty piece of failed work. Why don't you go for a long swim, face down in that foul green "pool" in your backyard? Or throw your withered old self into the sow pens in the backyard of the house next door? You have nothing of any value to contribute in any venue. Curl up and let the inevitable happen, but leave the rest of us out of your mess.
If by "nuts" you mean a neutered failure, then you are correct.

Message.Title: AT&T's presumed 30yr bond offering
Message.Msg: CS views this move to be a slightly negative since it is unknown how these funds will used and more importantly yet what rates will do in the long run. If the long term rates go down further, the recall of these bonds will be highly problematic and vice versa. It is a gamble on long term rates to say the least. CS estimates this offering to be in the order of $10.00B.

Topic.Title: "What difference, at this point, does it make?"

Message.Msg: ...Frog boy has problems with the President saying: “al Qaeda is on the path to defeat and bin Laden is dead…I ended the war in Iraq, as I promised…We are transitioning out of Afghanistan. We have gone after the terrorists who actually attacked us 9/11…” Tell us, tadpole, what’s your problem? I’m pretty sure bin Laden is, in fact, dead, is he not? I’m pretty sure the President DID end our involvement in Iraq, did he not? I also believe we ARE transitioning out of Afghanistan, are we not? And this president DID go after the terrorists “WHO ACTUALLY ATTACKED US”, not invade a country that had nothing to do with attacking us, under a fabricated pretense of WMD. We understand that you Tea brains are not at all happy about the many ongoing successes of a talented Commander-in-Chief. Trying to suggest that the above statements somehow connect to your wacked-out Benghazi conspiracy is one of your further stretches of reality. No one would suggest that “on the path to defeat” can be misinterpreted (as you have attempted to do) as meaning the war is over and all threats are eliminated. There was, however, a different situation in which the President did say really silly things which could have led you to believe that. Were you as appalled back then as you are now, when this was said?: May 1, 2003, aboard the carrier U.S. Abraham Lincoln under a banner printed up by the White House stating, “Mission Accomplished”… After arriving in a Lockheed SB-3 Viking (the carrier was well within range of the president’s helicopter at the time) President George W. Bush, grinning from ear to ear in a flight suit, stated, “In the Battle of Iraq, the United States and our allies have prevailed." A month later, in Afghanistan, he said "America sent you on a mission to remove a grave threat and to liberate an oppressed people, and that mission has been accomplished.” Some 8109 combined coalition casualties, 6706 of them American, later, the current President is doing his best to untangle the mess he inherited. He’s doing a splendid job, and it’s most unfortunate that you extremist crackpots are so bitter and unhappy about it. It’s also absolutely reprehensible that you do nothing constructive whatsoever, but intentionally lie about every issue before you. Benghazi investigation?…give me a break, frog boy. Why don’t you pass some gun legislation or end the sequester instead of wasting everybody’s time? Or maybe come up with the half billion dollars in embassy security funding requested by the administration in 20011 & ’12, that House Republicans refused to grant. In your pond, you know you’re all wet.

Message.Title: Going to forty and split IMHO
Message.Msg: Buybacks forthcoming.
I think you're going to need to offer him a payment plan. Wilkes couldn't put his hands on $1,000 in one shot if his life depended on it. Would you be willing to take it in government cheese?

AT&T is heavily financed by debt but the interest expense is only about 4.6% on the debt and return on equity is 7.92% so shareholders benefit from the debt. CS should not worry about how the money will be used. Let the auditors worry about that. If it is used to buy back shares the shareholders will benefit even more.
Far too many unknowns as to how the funds will be used: 1. Refinance debt; 2. CPAX; and 3. Buyback shares.
Considering the source of your comment I will pay no attention. I will put my thumbs up score against yours any day of the week.

Topic.Title: "What difference, at this point, does it make?"

Message.Msg: Yeah, it is fiction. The fact is Congress and the ARB have had access to over 25,000 pages of documents and people involved at all levels in multiple hearings and reviews. And still you have not managed to find any wrong-doing (no fibs) beyond what the ARB found (systematic management and leadership failures). My point is that even if your wildest fantasies come true, there's *still* nothing there that would come close to hurting the President or make him resign. The other fiction here is the supposed cover-up or stonewalling. This entire hearing today is based on an astounding amount of access to documents, transcripts and executive personnel. You have every version of the "evil" talking points available. But we know for you Tea Brain types actual evidence doesn't hold much sway. Patriotic Americans know that if this is the worst thing that happens under Obama's watch, we should count our blessings. But you're not a patriotic American. You're a partisan first, American second. Now we could talk about whether Al Qaeda is making a comeback or not, and our policy options there. That is a worthy discussion to have. But it is not one you are interested in because it is a conversation that is good for America. As an unpatriotic partisan, you are more interested in pinning something, anything, on Obama, no matter how far-fetched our outlandish that possibility actually is, and no matter how much it distracts us from actually accomplishing something.
Well written Wilkie. Still plenty of more shares to buy back and other areas of expansion as well.
Well written Wilkie. Still a lot of shares remain to be bought as well as other areas of company expansion.
Happy to oblige.

Message.Title: Volume back to normal
Message.Msg: The last seven sessions volume has been below the average of the last 50 sessions. In the first 45 minutes today volume has been the normal million shares every 15 minutes. Hopefully that indicates that the up move of yesterday and so far today are also normal and likely to continue.

Uh, okay. However, you did pay attention to it; sufficient attention to take the time to write out a response. You do still have enough brain cells firing in unison to realize how absurd writing about your "ignoring" is, don't you? "Thumbs up score"...what are you, the emotional equivalent of a high school girl in Depends? Go take that swim, you dotty old nincompoop.
Had to give you a thumbs up. Sorry. Anything that gets the nattering old teabag capons on this board riled up and reminds them they're still alive for a couple of minutes is a service to society.
From Fox News lying right to your keyboard.

You're right about some some retiree's wasting a cash out by making lousy investment choices Lew. I took the cash out and never looked back. Unfortunately, not everyone takes the time to learn some financial planning and sound budgeting in preparation for retirement. I know a few retiree's that lost a significant amount of their cash out and went back to work. Some chose a financial advisor and it was about 50-50. But in the long run, if you become a student of the game and learn investing and economics, you can do it yourself and do reasonably well. In hindsight, your choices in purchasing T stock was a good one wasn't it?
Well the market seems to like the idea of more cash. The stock price is reacting well ever since the bond idea was put out.

Shouldn't you have just written about someone you knew 50 years ago, or a tedious paragraph or two on your interpretation of the flood, or threatened someone with dire predictions from your misguided interpretation of Revelations?
If you're employed, how well is your companies retirement fund looking? Or are you a government or civil service pension employee?

Message.Title: Last chance to buy Vuzi on the cheap - breaking out! Worlds first smart glasses - Will forever change cell phone
Message.Msg: The technology is here, shipping summer 2013
Shouldn't you have just kept your useless thought to yourself? Bye the way, Revelation has no "s". It is all one revelation.
No. I don't think so. Why don't you try following your own advice, bigmouth?
Also, Miss Beadle, it's "By the way"..unless you are finally going "Bye Bye", which would be very nice.

Doubt you've ever read Revelations. So how would you know whether anyone was right or wrong in interpretation? It speaks in pretty plain language for the most part and identifies those causing the worlds problems in chapters 2 and 3.
Actually, all good uses for money to be borrowed at bargain basement rates.

I have read it. It's a piece of lunatic garbage. Apparently, my little scholar, it's "Revelation", not "Revelations". With a copy in every bathroom in the house and the time you spend in the bathroom, I think you'd know that. You're a very boring person, do you realize that?
Volume has dropped off dramatically and is now less than half of normal volume after 3.5 hours.
Yes, T now appears to be on a duplicate track of yesterday. This is good.

The calculus of borrowing isn't that easy. Borrow tons of money do buybacks and then what? You are locked in and owe the money indefinitely while there is considerable more flexibility with the dividends. Nothing prevents a company from reducing the dividend while if the company has outstanding bonds, forget it. Not much can be done there. If AT&T's approach made economic dollars and sense, all companies would rush to do the same. To be sure, the case of AAPL is entirely different with the proceeds to do buybacks/dividends. How? AAPL has the funds in international markets and by issuing bonds, they have achieved "tax avoidance," entirely different matter, no similarities whatsoever.
"The calculus of borrowing isn't that easy." Actually it is. In a large, stable, utility like AT&T it doesn't take calculus to determine that borrowing when rates are very low is a wise decision.

Topic.Title: "What difference, at this point, does it make?"

Message.Msg: What? I want some of what you're smoking. I caused this dysfunction? Really? Now I know you have gone over the edge and are in serious need of a mental health professional. I spent most of today watching the Benghazi hearings. What a lesson in futility that has been. Most of the left leaning members didn't even ask questions, they only made political speeches and blamed the entire incident on budget cuts, while the State Department was issuing statements saying that budget didn't enter into the problems. None of them, on either side seem to listen to one another. One guys would ask the same question put forth by another member of the committee just moments before and when getting the same answer seemed to not understand the answer, often times when the answer was yes or no. I am surprised while listening to many of these members how they were able to make a campaign speech sufficient to get elected....

Topic.Title: "What difference, at this point, does it make?"

Message.Msg: One question was asked today that no one in the State Department can answer...knowing that Sept. 11th was a special day in the Arab world and that ALL embassies had been put on notice to be especially aware, was the Ambassador in Libya traveling to a city that even the Libyan government said was not safe? Why just a month prior to that event were 12 of the 14 Special Forces unit assigned as security pulled and send home? Another one was, and it still hasn’t been answered is why did Ms. Rice go out with her statements when even the Libyan government was saying this was a terror attack partly by the group that they had sent to provide protection for the American Embassy?

Good post 'ncguras', I've read some of your other m/b posts today also. Lets hope they (RDS-B & others) do it right. I have some indirect interest in RDS-B and will be watching them over the near future. Thx, your post was a good heads-up.

Topic.Title: "What difference, at this point, does it make?"

Message.Msg: Good. May this will be the last time you Tea Brains make the families of the victims endure one of these contrived media spectacles. And maybe, just maybe, the representatives you elected will actually get down to business.

Message.Title: How about this.....
Message.Msg: 4 Americans died in Benghazi, 3,600 Americans died and over 30,000 were wounded in the war in Iraq. We were lied into the war. There was no exit plan. Troops were not properly protected. And yet the Republicans, Conservatives and Neocons spent NO time questioning why young people had to die or were maimed. The cost of that war (unfunded) will be over 1 trillion dollars. What hypocrites these people are.

Topic.Title: "What difference, at this point, does it make?"

Message.Msg: If locked up all the liars in government there would be no one left. They thrive on lies and the fools that believe them.
